You should not let your knees go past your toes or your chest caving inward, and you should not lean forward or backward. Keep your weight in your heels and your glutes engaged to maintain stability and control throughout the movement.

The SEER is the rating system used for measuring energy efficiency of appliances, and it stands for Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio. This measurement is calculated by dividing the total amount of energy consumed by an appliance over the course of a year by the total amount of energy that the same appliance would consume if it were operated over the entire year at its maximum efficiency.

This is a good way to measure the energy efficiency of appliances because it takes into account how the appliance is used throughout the year, rather than just looking at its maximum efficiency.

It is important to look at the SEER when buying a new appliance, such as a central air conditioner, because it will give you an idea of how much energy the appliance will use and how much it will cost to operate.
